content: Get rid of things you don’t want. Give your bedroom new life and make it feel instantly bigger by simply getting rid of stuff you don’t want or need anymore. Focus on clothes you don’t wear, toys you’ve grown out of, or items that don’t belong in your bedroom. Try using four different boxes to organize all the items in your room: for trash, give away, keep, or relocate. Try to throw away or give away as many things as possible, move others to different rooms, and finally put back all the “keep” items. [1] Consider whether you are able to store some things in your room elsewhere in the house. Can you put all your off-season clothes in a hall closet or basement? Could toys or clothes you’ve grown out of go to a younger sibling or even a neighbor? Organize with cute boxes and drawers. Use storage containers to easily organize and categorize items in your room. Look for cute or colorful ones that will be decorative as well as practical. Try buying cloth boxes or hanging shelves meant for your closet, where you can designate one for socks, one for belts, one for underwear, etc. On your desk, you could have colorful boxes and trays for papers, pencils, and other school or art supplies. You don’t always have to buy new storage containers. Try creating your own cute and colorful containers by wrapping plain boxes, cans, or bins with patterned paper or fabric for an easy upgrade. [2] You can also add hanging storage to the back of a door with a couple hooks and rods for clothes, jewelry, and accessories. [3] Clean up the space. Get your room super clean and tidy before you do any repainting or reorganizing. This will let you visualize changes and move furniture and other items around more easily. Move everything out of your room completely if you’re repainting. If you’ll just be rearranging and decorating, simply take out smaller things to make it easier to move furniture around. Take smaller items off of the surfaces of tables, shelves, or nightstands so they won’t get bumped or broken when reorganizing. This will also let you dust or clean surfaces, and rethink where you might put your smaller objects. Use light-colored paint. If you can repaint the walls in your room, pick a light or neutral color to help make the space feel bigger and more open. Try using different shades of the same color for the walls, trim, and other detailing. [4] Use a different, bright color for your ceiling, which will draw the eye upward and make the ceiling feel higher. Paint two opposite walls a slightly different color to create more interest and make the room seem longer. Lay down a large rug. Make sure to use a rug that is very large to make your room feel bigger instead of smaller. Stick to a light color or an elongating pattern to keep it feeling open. Try a rug with a striped pattern to help make the room feel wider. Place it so that the stripes are going in the same direction as the longest orientation of the room. [5] A nice light carpet or wood floors in your room may not need a rug at all and will feel bigger without it. However, a dark floor or one that’s not in good shape will benefit from a light-colored, large rug to cover it. Pile your bed with blankets and pillows. Make your bed seem new and extra comfy just by adding bedding to it. Layer on several blankets and colorful accent pillows to create a plush place to sleep and hang out. Make your bed the focal point in your room with lots of bedding, then try to keep the rest of your decor more minimal. This will help draw your eye to the bed and make the room seem bigger. Whether or not you have a daybed, arrange your pillows and blankets to act like a couch for extra seating during the day before it transforms into your bed at night. This could reduce the need for other chairs or sofas in your room. Supplement natural light with additional lighting. Keep windows open to let in natural light to your room, which will make it feel bigger and more pleasant. Add mirrors and several sources of light to brighten it at night or or in low natural light. Use curtains or drapes that are the same light color as your walls, or completely sheer. Keep them pulled back during the day to let the full amount of light in. [6] Place small and large mirrors around your room to reflect light and make the space feel even more open. Use several sources of light, like lamps, string lights, or built-in lights to create a bright and cozy atmosphere. [7] Add a dressing area. This can be a fun touch to add a girly flare to your room. Choose an area with good lighting. Somewhere by the window would work great. You should also choose an area with paler walls. [8] Place a closet or cabinet full of clothes near this area. Set up a full length mirror just by the cabinet. See if you can find a tailor mannequin online. You can throw a cute dress on the mannequin to signify this is the dressing area. String photos on Christmas lights. Photos of friends and family members can perk up your room. Get some Christmas lights at a supermarket. Get some cheap clips or clothes pins. Choose a variety of photos you want to display. [9] Hang up the Christmas lights in a series of rows somewhere in your room. Clip photos between each light. You will have a fun, cute addition to your room. Use a hanger to store your sunglasses. Do you have a large collection of sunglasses? If so, you can pick a cute, colorful hanger. Hang it up somewhere in your room, such as the doorknob to your closet. You can hang all your sunglasses from the edge of the hanger. [10] You can also paint a white hanger in a color you like. Some stores may sell hangers with cute designs, like polka dots. Add personalized decorations. Make a trip to the local mall or shopping center. Buy some decorations that speak to your personal style. [11] Is there a band you love? See if you can find a poster of that band. What's your favorite movie? See if you can find a poster of that. Look for stickers or bumper stickers with cute expressions that you relate to. You can put these up on a bulletin board above your desk. You can also look for lamps, rugs, and throw pillows with a color or design you like. Move your furniture around. Upgrade your bedroom without having to buy anything new by simply rearranging the furniture to new places. You can also make the room appear bigger just by keeping furniture to a minimum and placing it strategically. Keep furniture against the walls to open up the space in a small room, but keep pieces of furniture from touching if possible to make the room feel less crowded. You can also try placing furniture along the longest view or walkway of your room, which is a diagonal. Use the empty spaces and corners behind furniture in this configuration for extra storage. [12] Use multi-purpose furniture with storage. Maximize the space and function in your room by using furniture that has storage spaces or can fit items underneath. Find ways to make a bed or seat also act as a way to hold your stuff. [13] If you can buy new furniture, look for items like an ottoman with a storage space inside, or a bed with drawers built in underneath. You can even buy a lofted bed (a bunk bed without the bottom bunk) and keep a desk, dresser, chair, or other larger items underneath. If you can’t buy new furniture, use the space under your bed to store boxes and bins, keep items tucked under a table or desk, or use a trunk as a seating area as well as for storage. Try floating shelves instead of bookcases. Make your room look bigger and more trendy by moving storage off the ground and onto the walls, if you can. Replace bulky bookshelves and cabinets with floating shelves and cubbies. Try using different-sized storage cubes mounted on the wall for an interesting way to store items by your bed or desk. [14] You don’t have to have fancy shelving to create wall storage. Try painting a simple wooden crate in your favorite color, then hanging it on the wall for easy display and storage of your stuff. [15]

</div>
<p>As you grow up into a teenager, it can be fun to redecorate your room to reflect your changing style and interests. A small bedroom is an extra challenge, as you don’t have much space to work with and it can quickly feel cluttered by furniture, decoration, and messiness. However, there are several ways you can easily redo a small room while also making it feel bigger! Learn how to use some organization, paint, and furniture to remake your bedroom into a cute teen room.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Cleaning_and_Reorganizing_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Cleaning_and_Reorganizing">Cleaning and Reorganizing</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-1-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-1-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_b3113acc6b" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b3113acc6b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Get rid of things you don’t want.</b> Give your bedroom new life and make it feel instantly bigger by simply getting rid of stuff you don’t want or need anymore. Focus on clothes you don’t wear, toys you’ve grown out of, or items that don’t belong in your bedroom.

<ul>
<li>Try using four different boxes to organize all the items in your room: for trash, give away, keep, or relocate. Try to throw away or give away as many things as possible, move others to different rooms, and finally put back all the “keep” items.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Consider whether you are able to store some things in your room elsewhere in the house. Can you put all your off-season clothes in a hall closet or basement? Could toys or clothes you’ve grown out of go to a younger sibling or even a neighbor?</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-2-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-2-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_a5998287ce" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a5998287ce')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Organize with cute boxes and drawers.</b> Use storage containers to easily organize and categorize items in your room. Look for cute or colorful ones that will be decorative as well as practical.

<ul>
<li>Try buying cloth boxes or hanging shelves meant for your closet, where you can designate one for socks, one for belts, one for underwear, etc. On your desk, you could have colorful boxes and trays for papers, pencils, and other school or art supplies.</li>
<li>You don’t always have to buy new storage containers. Try creating your own cute and colorful containers by wrapping plain boxes, cans, or bins with patterned paper or fabric for an easy upgrade.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>You can also add hanging storage to the back of a door with a couple hooks and rods for clothes, jewelry, and accessories.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-3-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-3-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_3f2eb8187c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3f2eb8187c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Clean up the space.</b> Get your room super clean and tidy before you do any repainting or reorganizing. This will let you visualize changes and move furniture and other items around more easily.

<ul>
<li>Move everything out of your room completely if you’re repainting. If you’ll just be rearranging and decorating, simply take out smaller things to make it easier to move furniture around.</li>
<li>Take smaller items off of the surfaces of tables, shelves, or nightstands so they won’t get bumped or broken when reorganizing. This will also let you dust or clean surfaces, and rethink where you might put your smaller objects.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>

</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Repainting_and_Redecorating_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Repainting_and_Redecorating">Repainting and Redecorating</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-4-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-4-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_774378082c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_774378082c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use light-colored paint.</b> If you can repaint the walls in your room, pick a light or neutral color to help make the space feel bigger and more open. Try using different shades of the same color for the walls, trim, and other detailing.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Use a different, bright color for your ceiling, which will draw the eye upward and make the ceiling feel higher.</li>
<li>Paint two opposite walls a slightly different color to create more interest and make the room seem longer.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-5-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-5-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_0af782cdfa" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0af782cdfa')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Lay down a large rug.</b> Make sure to use a rug that is very large to make your room feel bigger instead of smaller. Stick to a light color or an elongating pattern to keep it feeling open.

<ul>
<li>Try a rug with a striped pattern to help make the room feel wider. Place it so that the stripes are going in the same direction as the longest orientation of the room.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A nice light carpet or wood floors in your room may not need a rug at all and will feel bigger without it. However, a dark floor or one that’s not in good shape will benefit from a light-colored, large rug to cover it.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-6-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-6-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_0484adbe9e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0484adbe9e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pile your bed with blankets and pillows.</b> Make your bed seem new and extra comfy just by adding bedding to it. Layer on several blankets and colorful accent pillows to create a plush place to sleep and hang out.

<ul>
<li>Make your bed the focal point in your room with lots of bedding, then try to keep the rest of your decor more minimal. This will help draw your eye to the bed and make the room seem bigger.</li>
<li>Whether or not you have a daybed, arrange your pillows and blankets to act like a couch for extra seating during the day before it transforms into your bed at night. This could reduce the need for other chairs or sofas in your room.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-7-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-7-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_4164d4a09c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4164d4a09c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Supplement natural light with additional lighting.</b> Keep windows open to let in natural light to your room, which will make it feel bigger and more pleasant. Add mirrors and several sources of light to brighten it at night or or in low natural light.

<ul>
<li>Use curtains or drapes that are the same light color as your walls, or completely sheer. Keep them pulled back during the day to let the full amount of light in.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Place small and large mirrors around your room to reflect light and make the space feel even more open. Use several sources of light, like lamps, string lights, or built-in lights to create a bright and cozy atmosphere.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-8-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-8-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_d955c0e449" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d955c0e449')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add a dressing area.</b> This can be a fun touch to add a girly flare to your room. Choose an area with good lighting. Somewhere by the window would work great. You should also choose an area with paler walls.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Place a closet or cabinet full of clothes near this area.</li>
<li>Set up a full length mirror just by the cabinet.</li>
<li>See if you can find a tailor mannequin online. You can throw a cute dress on the mannequin to signify this is the dressing area.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-9-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-9-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_589402a875" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_589402a875')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">String photos on Christmas lights.</b> Photos of friends and family members can perk up your room. Get some Christmas lights at a supermarket. Get some cheap clips or clothes pins. Choose a variety of photos you want to display.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Hang up the Christmas lights in a series of rows somewhere in your room.</li>
<li>Clip photos between each light. You will have a fun, cute addition to your room.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-10-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-10-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_9c23dfd30c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9c23dfd30c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use a hanger to store your sunglasses.</b> Do you have a large collection of sunglasses? If so, you can pick a cute, colorful hanger. Hang it up somewhere in your room, such as the doorknob to your closet. You can hang all your sunglasses from the edge of the hanger.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You can also paint a white hanger in a color you like.</li>
<li>Some stores may sell hangers with cute designs, like polka dots.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-11-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-11-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_fee35183ba" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fee35183ba')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add personalized decorations.</b> Make a trip to the local mall or shopping center. Buy some decorations that speak to your personal style.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Is there a band you love? See if you can find a poster of that band. What's your favorite movie? See if you can find a poster of that.</li>
<li>Look for stickers or bumper stickers with cute expressions that you relate to. You can put these up on a bulletin board above your desk.</li>
<li>You can also look for lamps, rugs, and throw pillows with a color or design you like.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>

</div>
</li>

<a class="anchor" name="Moving_or_Changing_Furniture_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Moving_or_Changing_Furniture">Moving or Changing Furniture</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-12-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-12-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_8a91eea9fe" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_8a91eea9fe')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Move your furniture around.</b> Upgrade your bedroom without having to buy anything new by simply rearranging the furniture to new places. You can also make the room appear bigger just by keeping furniture to a minimum and placing it strategically.

<ul>
<li>Keep furniture against the walls to open up the space in a small room, but keep pieces of furniture from touching if possible to make the room feel less crowded.</li>
<li>You can also try placing furniture along the longest view or walkway of your room, which is a diagonal. Use the empty spaces and corners behind furniture in this configuration for extra storage.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-13.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_fb52bc31fe" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fb52bc31fe')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-13.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use multi-purpose furniture with storage.</b> Maximize the space and function in your room by using furniture that has storage spaces or can fit items underneath. Find ways to make a bed or seat also act as a way to hold your stuff.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you can buy new furniture, look for items like an ottoman with a storage space inside, or a bed with drawers built in underneath. You can even buy a lofted bed (a bunk bed without the bottom bunk) and keep a desk, dresser, chair, or other larger items underneath.</li>
<li>If you can’t buy new furniture, use the space under your bed to store boxes and bins, keep items tucked under a table or desk, or use a trunk as a seating area as well as for storage.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=614795" href="#/Image:Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-(Girls)-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-14.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_f747bcfc23" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f747bcfc23')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-14.jpg/aid614795-v4-728px-Redo-a-Small-Teen-Bedroom-%28Girls%29-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try floating shelves instead of bookcases.</b> Make your room look bigger and more trendy by moving storage off the ground and onto the walls, if you can. Replace bulky bookshelves and cabinets with floating shelves and cubbies.

<ul>
<li>Try using different-sized storage cubes mounted on the wall for an interesting way to store items by your bed or desk.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>You don’t have to have fancy shelving to create wall storage. Try painting a simple wooden crate in your favorite color, then hanging it on the wall for easy display and storage of your stuff.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="614795" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs qa_waittheresmore" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="410231" data-caid="411104" data-cqid="410248" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2316931" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="9">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I am looking to repaint my room, but I can't decide on the color to paint it. What color scheme is best for a teen girl?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Usually a neutral white, pastel blue, or pastel pink are the ideal options. Any pastel colors can work out well if you like a different one. Lighter colors tend to look nicer, especially when you have a lot of things in your room. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>9</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="433916" data-caid="434789" data-cqid="433933" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2348900" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="8">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I have a bookshelf full of books. Should I still install shelves?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, you could do that if you want additional storage space. It's entirely up to you though! </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>8</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="74535" data-caid="75408" data-cqid="74552" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="291150" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="4" data-votes_up="27">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is it better to have your bed near a window?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">It depends on the configuration of your room and your own preference. Placing your bed right by a window can help make it feel lighter and your room more open. However, you don't want to make the space feel smaller by placing a bed in the middle of the room and in the way of where you'll walk. You may or may not like having the sun wake you up in the morning, too! So it's up to you where you place your bed, but a window can definitely be a good option.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>4</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>27</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="485121" data-caid="485994" data-cqid="485138" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2049420" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="6">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What if I am having a sleppover in an hour and I still have to paint?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You should not paint if you only have an hour left, because the chemicals in the paint can still be harmful to you and your friends. You should save the painting for a time when you can evacuate the room and not be exposed to the harmful chemicals.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>6</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="444386" data-caid="445259" data-cqid="444403" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2420468" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="5">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I redo my room if I share it with someone?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, if you and your roommate agree on a particular theme and design, and if your landlord and/or parents are okay with it.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>5</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="499939" data-caid="500812" data-cqid="499956" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2588270" data-submitter_id="5111621" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="5">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">My room is a very odd shape. I have a big working table and a bed. What can I do if I feel claustrophobic?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-0hhcvWverkc/AAAAAAAAAAI/AAAAAAAAABQ/bVf4Dzx6Shg/s96-c/photo.jpg)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Isabella-Peters">Isabella Peters</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Try lightening it up. Natural light and lighter-colored walls can make a space seem bigger. Mirrors can also help to create the illusion of more space, and you could try moving your bed to a wall instead of having it stick out in the middle.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>

<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>5</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="485119" data-caid="485992" data-cqid="485136" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2228562" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="5">

<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I make a bed smaller?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>

<div class="qa_answer answer">You can buy a smaller bed, and sell the bed that you currently have if it is too big for your room.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="484656" data-caid="485529" data-cqid="484673" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2529081" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="4">

<div class="qa_q_txt question">Will hanging pictures or art on a wall make the room look bigger?</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="407290" data-caid="408163" data-cqid="407307" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2148805" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="9">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I still decorate my room if I have a bunk bed? </div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, the only difference with having a bunk bed is that it is much taller than other beds. You can rearrange your furniture (including your bed) and give it a personal touch. If necessary, you can even repaint the entire bedroom.</div>

<div class="qa_q_txt question">My room is small, and I have things I need, but my room is cluttered. What do I do?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">The first thing you've got to do is tidy up. This way you can see what you're working with. From there you can find all of the things you don't really need and put them all in a pile. After you have done that, start sketching how you want your room to look, or even just imagining it in your mind. Then put your plan into action.</div>

    "author": {

        "sameAs": [

    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Cleaning and Reorganizing",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Get rid of things you don\u2019t want. Give your bedroom new life and make it feel instantly bigger by simply getting rid of stuff you don\u2019t want or need anymore. Focus on clothes you don\u2019t wear, toys you\u2019ve grown out of, or items that don\u2019t belong in your bedroom.\n\nTry using four different boxes to organize all the items in your room: for trash, give away, keep, or relocate. Try to throw away or give away as many things as possible, move others to different rooms, and finally put back all the \u201ckeep\u201d items.[1]\nConsider whether you are able to store some things in your room elsewhere in the house. Can you put all your off-season clothes in a hall closet or basement? Could toys or clothes you\u2019ve grown out of go to a younger sibling or even a neighbor?"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Organize with cute boxes and drawers. Use storage containers to easily organize and categorize items in your room. Look for cute or colorful ones that will be decorative as well as practical.\n\nTry buying cloth boxes or hanging shelves meant for your closet, where you can designate one for socks, one for belts, one for underwear, etc. On your desk, you could have colorful boxes and trays for papers, pencils, and other school or art supplies.\nYou don\u2019t always have to buy new storage containers. Try creating your own cute and colorful containers by wrapping plain boxes, cans, or bins with patterned paper or fabric for an easy upgrade.[2]\nYou can also add hanging storage to the back of a door with a couple hooks and rods for clothes, jewelry, and accessories.[3]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Clean up the space. Get your room super clean and tidy before you do any repainting or reorganizing. This will let you visualize changes and move furniture and other items around more easily.\n\nMove everything out of your room completely if you\u2019re repainting. If you\u2019ll just be rearranging and decorating, simply take out smaller things to make it easier to move furniture around.\nTake smaller items off of the surfaces of tables, shelves, or nightstands so they won\u2019t get bumped or broken when reorganizing. This will also let you dust or clean surfaces, and rethink where you might put your smaller objects."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Repainting and Redecorating",
            "position": 2,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Use light-colored paint. If you can repaint the walls in your room, pick a light or neutral color to help make the space feel bigger and more open. Try using different shades of the same color for the walls, trim, and other detailing.[4]\nUse a different, bright color for your ceiling, which will draw the eye upward and make the ceiling feel higher.\nPaint two opposite walls a slightly different color to create more interest and make the room seem longer."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Lay down a large rug. Make sure to use a rug that is very large to make your room feel bigger instead of smaller. Stick to a light color or an elongating pattern to keep it feeling open.\n\nTry a rug with a striped pattern to help make the room feel wider. Place it so that the stripes are going in the same direction as the longest orientation of the room.[5]\nA nice light carpet or wood floors in your room may not need a rug at all and will feel bigger without it. However, a dark floor or one that\u2019s not in good shape will benefit from a light-colored, large rug to cover it."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pile your bed with blankets and pillows. Make your bed seem new and extra comfy just by adding bedding to it. Layer on several blankets and colorful accent pillows to create a plush place to sleep and hang out.\n\nMake your bed the focal point in your room with lots of bedding, then try to keep the rest of your decor more minimal. This will help draw your eye to the bed and make the room seem bigger.\nWhether or not you have a daybed, arrange your pillows and blankets to act like a couch for extra seating during the day before it transforms into your bed at night. This could reduce the need for other chairs or sofas in your room."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Supplement natural light with additional lighting. Keep windows open to let in natural light to your room, which will make it feel bigger and more pleasant. Add mirrors and several sources of light to brighten it at night or or in low natural light.\n\nUse curtains or drapes that are the same light color as your walls, or completely sheer. Keep them pulled back during the day to let the full amount of light in.[6]\nPlace small and large mirrors around your room to reflect light and make the space feel even more open. Use several sources of light, like lamps, string lights, or built-in lights to create a bright and cozy atmosphere.[7]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add a dressing area. This can be a fun touch to add a girly flare to your room. Choose an area with good lighting. Somewhere by the window would work great. You should also choose an area with paler walls.[8]\nPlace a closet or cabinet full of clothes near this area.\nSet up a full length mirror just by the cabinet.\nSee if you can find a tailor mannequin online. You can throw a cute dress on the mannequin to signify this is the dressing area."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "String photos on Christmas lights. Photos of friends and family members can perk up your room. Get some Christmas lights at a supermarket. Get some cheap clips or clothes pins. Choose a variety of photos you want to display.[9]\nHang up the Christmas lights in a series of rows somewhere in your room.\nClip photos between each light. You will have a fun, cute addition to your room."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Use a hanger to store your sunglasses. Do you have a large collection of sunglasses? If so, you can pick a cute, colorful hanger. Hang it up somewhere in your room, such as the doorknob to your closet. You can hang all your sunglasses from the edge of the hanger.[10]\nYou can also paint a white hanger in a color you like.\nSome stores may sell hangers with cute designs, like polka dots."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add personalized decorations. Make a trip to the local mall or shopping center. Buy some decorations that speak to your personal style.[11]\nIs there a band you love? See if you can find a poster of that band. What's your favorite movie? See if you can find a poster of that.\nLook for stickers or bumper stickers with cute expressions that you relate to. You can put these up on a bulletin board above your desk.\nYou can also look for lamps, rugs, and throw pillows with a color or design you like."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Moving or Changing Furniture",
            "position": 3,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Move your furniture around. Upgrade your bedroom without having to buy anything new by simply rearranging the furniture to new places. You can also make the room appear bigger just by keeping furniture to a minimum and placing it strategically.\n\nKeep furniture against the walls to open up the space in a small room, but keep pieces of furniture from touching if possible to make the room feel less crowded.\nYou can also try placing furniture along the longest view or walkway of your room, which is a diagonal. Use the empty spaces and corners behind furniture in this configuration for extra storage.[12]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Use multi-purpose furniture with storage. Maximize the space and function in your room by using furniture that has storage spaces or can fit items underneath. title: How to Redo a Small Teen Bedroom (Girls)
content_html:
Get rid of things you don’t want. Give your bedroom new life and make it feel instantly bigger by simply getting rid of stuff you don’t want or need anymore. Focus on clothes you don’t wear, toys you’ve grown out of, or items that don’t belong in your bedroom.
  • Try using four different boxes to organize all the items in your room: for trash, give away, keep, or relocate. Try to throw away or give away as many things as possible, move others to different rooms, and finally put back all the “keep” items.[1]
  • Consider whether you are able to store some things in your room elsewhere in the house. Can you put all your off-season clothes in a hall closet or basement? Could toys or clothes you’ve grown out of go to a younger sibling or even a neighbor?
Organize with cute boxes and drawers. Use storage containers to easily organize and categorize items in your room. Look for cute or colorful ones that will be decorative as well as practical.
  • Try buying cloth boxes or hanging shelves meant for your closet, where you can designate one for socks, one for belts, one for underwear, etc. On your desk, you could have colorful boxes and trays for papers, pencils, and other school or art supplies.
  • You don’t always have to buy new storage containers. Try creating your own cute and colorful containers by wrapping plain boxes, cans, or bins with patterned paper or fabric for an easy upgrade.[2]
  • You can also add hanging storage to the back of a door with a couple hooks and rods for clothes, jewelry, and accessories.[3]
Clean up the space. Get your room super clean and tidy before you do any repainting or reorganizing. This will let you visualize changes and move furniture and other items around more easily.
  • Move everything out of your room completely if you’re repainting. If you’ll just be rearranging and decorating, simply take out smaller things to make it easier to move furniture around.
  • Take smaller items off of the surfaces of tables, shelves, or nightstands so they won’t get bumped or broken when reorganizing. This will also let you dust or clean surfaces, and rethink where you might put your smaller objects.
Use light-colored paint. If you can repaint the walls in your room, pick a light or neutral color to help make the space feel bigger and more open. Try using different shades of the same color for the walls, trim, and other detailing.[4]
  • Use a different, bright color for your ceiling, which will draw the eye upward and make the ceiling feel higher.
  • Paint two opposite walls a slightly different color to create more interest and make the room seem longer.
Lay down a large rug. Make sure to use a rug that is very large to make your room feel bigger instead of smaller. Stick to a light color or an elongating pattern to keep it feeling open.
  • Try a rug with a striped pattern to help make the room feel wider. Place it so that the stripes are going in the same direction as the longest orientation of the room.[5]
  • A nice light carpet or wood floors in your room may not need a rug at all and will feel bigger without it. However, a dark floor or one that’s not in good shape will benefit from a light-colored, large rug to cover it.
Pile your bed with blankets and pillows. Make your bed seem new and extra comfy just by adding bedding to it. Layer on several blankets and colorful accent pillows to create a plush place to sleep and hang out.
  • Make your bed the focal point in your room with lots of bedding, then try to keep the rest of your decor more minimal. This will help draw your eye to the bed and make the room seem bigger.
  • Whether or not you have a daybed, arrange your pillows and blankets to act like a couch for extra seating during the day before it transforms into your bed at night. This could reduce the need for other chairs or sofas in your room.
Supplement natural light with additional lighting. Keep windows open to let in natural light to your room, which will make it feel bigger and more pleasant. Add mirrors and several sources of light to brighten it at night or or in low natural light.
  • Use curtains or drapes that are the same light color as your walls, or completely sheer. Keep them pulled back during the day to let the full amount of light in.[6]
  • Place small and large mirrors around your room to reflect light and make the space feel even more open. Use several sources of light, like lamps, string lights, or built-in lights to create a bright and cozy atmosphere.[7]
Add a dressing area. This can be a fun touch to add a girly flare to your room. Choose an area with good lighting. Somewhere by the window would work great. You should also choose an area with paler walls.[8]
  • Place a closet or cabinet full of clothes near this area.
  • Set up a full length mirror just by the cabinet.
  • See if you can find a tailor mannequin online. You can throw a cute dress on the mannequin to signify this is the dressing area.
String photos on Christmas lights. Photos of friends and family members can perk up your room. Get some Christmas lights at a supermarket. Get some cheap clips or clothes pins. Choose a variety of photos you want to display.[9]
  • Hang up the Christmas lights in a series of rows somewhere in your room.
  • Clip photos between each light. You will have a fun, cute addition to your room.
Use a hanger to store your sunglasses. Do you have a large collection of sunglasses? If so, you can pick a cute, colorful hanger. Hang it up somewhere in your room, such as the doorknob to your closet. You can hang all your sunglasses from the edge of the hanger.[10]
  • You can also paint a white hanger in a color you like.
  • Some stores may sell hangers with cute designs, like polka dots.
Add personalized decorations. Make a trip to the local mall or shopping center. Buy some decorations that speak to your personal style.[11]
  • Is there a band you love? See if you can find a poster of that band. What's your favorite movie? See if you can find a poster of that.
  • Look for stickers or bumper stickers with cute expressions that you relate to. You can put these up on a bulletin board above your desk.
  • You can also look for lamps, rugs, and throw pillows with a color or design you like.
Move your furniture around. Upgrade your bedroom without having to buy anything new by simply rearranging the furniture to new places. You can also make the room appear bigger just by keeping furniture to a minimum and placing it strategically.
  • Keep furniture against the walls to open up the space in a small room, but keep pieces of furniture from touching if possible to make the room feel less crowded.
  • You can also try placing furniture along the longest view or walkway of your room, which is a diagonal. Use the empty spaces and corners behind furniture in this configuration for extra storage.[12]
Use multi-purpose furniture with storage. Maximize the space and function in your room by using furniture that has storage spaces or can fit items underneath. Find ways to make a bed or seat also act as a way to hold your stuff.[13]
  • If you can buy new furniture, look for items like an ottoman with a storage space inside, or a bed with drawers built in underneath. You can even buy a lofted bed (a bunk bed without the bottom bunk) and keep a desk, dresser, chair, or other larger items underneath.
  • If you can’t buy new furniture, use the space under your bed to store boxes and bins, keep items tucked under a table or desk, or use a trunk as a seating area as well as for storage.
Try floating shelves instead of bookcases. Make your room look bigger and more trendy by moving storage off the ground and onto the walls, if you can. Replace bulky bookshelves and cabinets with floating shelves and cubbies.
  • Try using different-sized storage cubes mounted on the wall for an interesting way to store items by your bed or desk.[14]
  • You don’t have to have fancy shelving to create wall storage. Try painting a simple wooden crate in your favorite color, then hanging it on the wall for easy display and storage of your stuff.[15]
